intro: Senecio brevior, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of foliage. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Senecio brevior is known for its hardy nature and ability to survive in arid conditions.
